name: Avoid Programs with High Average size of Statements (AVGS)  (FORTRAN)
description: This calculation is using the results of the calculated Halstead metrics n1, n2, N1 and N2. This diagnostic is a result of this calculation
rationale:
AVGS: This metric (Average Size of statements) corresponds to the average number of operands and operators used by each of the component's executable statements.
It is calculated as follows:
        AVGS = (N1+N2) / STMT;
 where:
        N1 is the number of operator occurrences,
        N2 is the number of operand occurrences,
        STMT is the number of executable statements in the component
alternativeName: Avoid Programs with High Average size of Statements (AVGS)  (FORTRAN)
